Name: Padded
Description: Padded armar consists of quilted layers of cloth and batting.

Name: Leather
Description: The breastplate and shoulder protectors of this armor are made of leather.

Name: Studded Leather
Description: Made from tough but flexible leather, studded leather is reinforced with close-set rivets ar spikes .

Name: HIde
Description: his crude armor consists of thick furs and pelts. lt is commonly worn by barbarian tribes, evil humanoids, and other folk who lack access to the tools and materiaIs needed lOcreate betler armor.

Name: Chain Shirt
Description: Made of interlocking metal rings, a chain shirl is worn belween layers of clothing ar leather. This armor offers modest protection to the wearer's upper body and allows lhe sound of the rings rubbing against one another to be muffled by outer layers.

Name: Scale Mail
Description: This armor consists of a coat and leggings (and perhaps a separate skirt) of leather covered with overlapping pieces of metal, much like the scales of a fish, The suit includes gauntlets.

Name: Breastplate
Description: This armor consists of a fitted metal chest piece worn with supple leather, Although it leaves the legs and arms relatively unprotected, this armor provides good protection for the wearer's vital organs while leaving the wearer relatively unencumbered,

Name: Half Plate
Description: Half plate consists of shaped metal plates that cover most of the wearer's body, 1tdoes not include leg protection beyond simple greaves that are attached with leather straps.

Name: Ring Mail
Description: This armor is leather armor with heavy rings sewn into it. The rings he1p reinforce the armor against blows from swords and axes. Ring mail is inferior to chain mail, and it"s usual1y worn only by those who can't afford better armor.

Name: Chain Mail
Description: Made of interlocking metal rings, chain mail includes a layer of quilted fabric worn underneath themail to prevent chafing and to cushion the impact of blows. The suit includes gauntlets.

Name: Splint
Description: This armor is made of narrow vertical strips of metal riveted to a backing of leather that is worn over c10th padding. Flcxible chain mail protects the joints.

Name: Plate
Description: Plate consists of shaped, interlocking metal plates to cover the entire body. A suit of plate includes gauntlets, heavy leather boots, a visored helmet, and thick layers of padding underneath the armor. Buckles and straps distribute the weight over the body.

Name: Keelboat
Description: Keelboats are used on lakes and rivers. If going downstream, add the speed of the current (typically 3 miles per hour) to the speed of  the vehicle. They can't be rowed against any significant current, but they can be pulled upstream by draft animals on the shores.

Name: Rowboat
Description: Rowboats are used on lakes and rivers. If going downstream, add the speed of the current (typically 3 miles per hour) to the speed of  the vehicle. They can't be rowed against any significant current, but they can be pulled upstream by draft animals on the shores. A rowboat weighs 100 pounds, in case adventurers carry it over land.
